text: I have this hooked to a Sears Shop Wet/Dry Vacuum.  As others have noted, the attachment size is a little "non-standard", probably due to the fact that the hose fits over the tools instead of sliding in them.  Nonetheless, the hose and swivel are easy to use and the material makes for very efficient pickup.  I also like the claw and crevice nozzle.  They are a bit small for small spaces in my small car, but they are great for going over floors, seats, and jobsite pickup.  Definitely recommended over the stock hose that comes with most shop & wet/dry vacs.

Sturdy with an adjustable mouth and blade tilt.Understand you will need to prep this before use. The sole is not precision ground but machine rough, so you will need a granite block and sandpaper or a set of flat block diamond hones. Once you have your sole (and sides) honed and flat you will need to sharpen the blade. There are several jigs and sharpening tools to assist in this. After all is done apply an anti-rust agent such as wood wax or Boeshield.Once prep'd this is a great plane.

I picked this game up at a store because it was on sale.  Got home and read reviews...almost returned it.  Glad I didn't because it actually works very well for my kids.  My daughter (4) and son (2 1/2) both love it and can always make a "basket" within about 4 tries.  My kids were actually better at it than my husband and myself!  Granted, we have to center the doggy for them so they're lined up to flip the ants, but I don't mind that.  Definitely wasn't too difficult for them.

I purchased this game to be used during a trip with my granddaughters ages 6 and 8.  They loved the game so much that one of them asked that I purchase another one just for them for their birthday.  It is a great tool to assist them in broadening their vocabulary and spelling skills while enjoying the competition of a game. It is easy to play and understand.  Melissa and Doug have designed a visibly appealing and durable product with all parts attached to the one board eliminating the chance of losing pieces.

If you have not already noticed, Diablo is easily located within Dungeons and Dragons. This is actually a benefit for Diablo, since it has very little story going on. This RPG/action hybrid is nice and it's multiplayer community is huge. Too bad there are millions of cheaters. Just be legit and everyone else will catch on. The game offers lots of fun. Not many complaints though. They are really your choice as to if they're bad or good. Get the game if you want. Not a wasted "money".

Dino Crisis is a great game -- lots of excitement, suspense, and action.  It doesn't fail there.  I beat it in four days (seven hours playing time), though, so definitely rent it first.Some of the voice acting is weak,  but it's not the worst out there.  The story will keep you interested, as  will the battles with the enemy dinosaurs.  An added plus is the decisions  you must make at key points in the story, but even this (and the different  costumes) isn't enough to give the game the replay value it needs to make  it a 5-star game.

This Sears Shop Wet/Dry Vacuum is equipped with my current setup. As others have pointed out, the attachment's size is somewhat unusual, likely due to the design that allows the hose to fit over the tools instead of sliding into them. In any case, the hose and swivel mechanism are easily operated, and the material used ensures highly efficient collection of debris. I particularly appreciate the claw and crevice nozzle, which, although slightly small for confined spaces in my compact car, are ideal for cleaning floors, seats, and tidying up work areas. I highly recommend choosing this option over the standard hose that usually accompanies most shop and wet/dry vacuums.

I currently have this connected to my Sears Shop Wet/Dry Vacuum. As mentioned by others, the size of the attachment is a bit unconventional, likely because the hose is designed to be placed over the tools instead of being inserted into them. Nonetheless, the hose and swivel feature are user-friendly, and the material used ensures highly efficient pickup of debris. I also find the claw and crevice nozzle to be convenient. While they may be slightly small for tight spaces in my small car, they work exceptionally well for cleaning floors, seats, and even for picking up debris at job sites. I highly recommend using this attachment instead of the standard hose typically provided with most shop and wet/dry vacuums.

With a durable construction and the ability to adjust the mouth and blade tilt, it is important to prepare this tool before using it. The sole is not precisely ground, but rather has a rough machine finish, which means you'll need a granite block and sandpaper or a set of flat block diamond hones to make it smooth. Once you have properly honed and flattened the sole (as well as the sides), you will then need to sharpen the blade. There are various jigs and sharpening tools available to help with this process. Finally, after completing all the necessary steps, you should apply an anti-rust agent like wood wax or Boeshield. Once prepared, this becomes an excellent plane.

This tool is sturdy and features an adjustable mouth and blade tilt. However, it requires preparation before use. The sole is not precision ground, but rather has a rough machine finish. To make it smooth, you'll need either a granite block and sandpaper or a set of flat block diamond hones. After honing and flattening the sole (along with the sides), you'll then proceed to sharpen the blade. There are various jigs and sharpening tools available to assist you with this task. Once all the steps are completed, it's advisable to apply an anti-rust agent such as wood wax or Boeshield. This tool becomes highly effective after proper preparation.

At a discounted price, I decided to purchase this game from a store. Initially considering returning it after reading reviews, I am now grateful I didn't because it is highly enjoyed by my 4-year-old daughter and 2 1/2-year-old son. Surprisingly, they excel at the game, surpassing both myself and my husband.

I acquired this game for the purpose of using it during a journey with my granddaughters, who are 6 and 8 years old. They were so fond of the game that one of them requested a separate one as a birthday gift. It proves to be an excellent resource for enhancing their vocabulary and spelling abilities, while offering the enjoyment of a competitive game. It is simple to play and understand. Melissa and Doug have designed an aesthetically pleasing and resilient product, with all the parts securely attached to the board, eliminating the possibility of losing any pieces.

It can be observed that Diablo is readily accessible within Dungeons and Dragons, which works in favor of Diablo due to its minimal storytelling. This hybrid RPG/action game is quite enjoyable, boasting a vast multiplayer community. It is regrettable, though, that there exists a multitude of cheaters. Adhere to fair play and others will eventually follow. The game offers substantial amusement, with minimal grievances that are subjective in nature. If desired, acquiring the game would be a judicious choice.

If you haven't already noticed, Diablo can be easily found within the realm of Dungeons and Dragons, which serves as an advantage for Diablo since it lacks a significant narrative. This game, combining elements of role-playing and action, is highly entertaining and has a thriving community of multiplayer enthusiasts. However, the presence of a large number of cheaters is a drawback. In order to enjoy the game fully, it's best to play fair and expect others to do the same. Overall, the game offers a great deal of fun with only a few subjective complaints. Consider purchasing it without hesitation.

However, by playing legitimately, you can encourage others to do the same. The game offers abundant entertainment, with few subjective drawbacks. Dino Crisis offers a captivating gaming experience, packed with excitement, suspense, and action. It is advisable to rent the game first as I managed to complete it in four days, playing for just seven hours. Although some of the voice acting could be improved, it is not the worst available. The intriguing storyline and intense battles against enemy dinosaurs will undoubtedly hold your interest. Moreover, the game presents pivotal decision-making moments within the plot, along with the option of different costumes. Nonetheless, these aspects are insufficient to elevate the game to a 5-star rating due to its lack of replay value.

With its thrilling gameplay, abundant excitement, and suspense, Dino Crisis emerges as an outstanding game. However, I recommend renting it first as it took me just four days, with a total playtime of seven hours, to beat it. While some of the voice acting falls short, it is far from the worst in the gaming industry. The captivating story and adrenaline-pumping encounters with enemy dinosaurs will certainly keep you engaged. The game also offers decision-making opportunities and different costume options as added bonuses. Nevertheless, these features are unable to bestow a 5-star rating upon the game due to its limited replay value.

Dino Crisis proves itself as an impressive game, delivering a remarkable blend of excitement, suspense, and action. Before making a purchase, I suggest renting it since I managed to complete it within four days, playing for just seven hours. Although the quality of the voice acting could be improved in certain areas, it does not reach the lowest standard available. The gripping storyline and intense dinosaur battles will keep you engrossed, as will the inclusion of decision-making moments throughout the narrative and the availability of various costumes. Nonetheless, these aspects fail to elevate the game to a 5-star status as it lacks the necessary replay value.

Nevertheless, these elements fail to provide the game with the necessary replay value for a 5-star rating.

However, these additional features do not provide the game with the replay value necessary to earn a 5-star rating.
